Fields.DialogueText: Captain! There's an issue!
Calm down, Edinburgh. What's going on?
My hands! My hands! Look!
I don't understand...
My gloves! They've gone!
Did you lose them?
No! They were stolen! Please, you have to help me find out what numpty did it!

Fields.MenuText: Okay, I will. Just calm down...
Do you have any suspects?
Where was the last place you saw them?

Fields.DialogueText: Good! Now we should hurry!
No, but with your help, I know we can find the culprit!
In your quarters, under my books. But they weren't there!
That's got to be annoying. It feels like only yesterday that I gave them to you...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Nobody's... said anything, have they?
Surely you don't mean-
No, I don't mean the M-word! I mean... if you do hear anything about the gloves, tell me right away.
*BOOM*
Priorities, Edinburgh. Keep those hands warm.
If I don't, those witches are getting an ice-cold jab direct to the face!
All I'm saying is, you're the most heavily armed vessel...
I know I am, but the answer is still no.
But just think of the advantages!
I'm already one of the strongest in my class. I mean, crivvens, they named my subclass after me!
What's going on in here?
Maybe the Captain will do better...
With what?
She was complaining about her lost gloves affecting her performance. I told her quantity could make up for quality.
You're not outfitting me with more weapons! What's wrong with the ones I have?
But think of how much faster this war could go!

Fields.MenuText: Let the Royal Navy and its engineers decide that.
We've got a nice balance between speed and firepower. Adding more armaments would endanger that.
It could give us a boost in battle.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. It's not my place.
But the possibilities...
If some is good, more is better, right?
We can debate the merits of my armament when I'm throwing back torpedo cocktails in dry dock. For now, I have a way you can help.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Right. I'll keep an eye out for your gloves.
I wonder...
What?
No. Can't let it get to me. Damn it, I really liked those gloves!
Captain, we have to talk about your diet.
What's wrong with my diet?
Well, you eat meat. And I respect that. But...
I think we can supplement it with something even healthier!
What's that?
Spinach! I have a can of it right here!

Fields.MenuText: Spinach! Yes!
Really?
I'm not sure I follow.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes! You'll get more iron and build more muscle! It's better than what you're eating now!
Without a doubt! Now, you should try some!
It is way more nutritious than anything you've been eating! It'll make you healthier, Captain!
I guess it wouldn't hurt to have some. But I can't help but think there's an ulterior motive.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
It's a super-food! Can't a Belle be interested in her captain's health?
Well, you don't strike me as a Thimble Theatre fan.
Fine! I'm not exactly quality without my gloves. You need to pick up the slack!
I'll help you look for them, Edinburgh. We can discuss the spinach when we're not under attack.

Fields.MenuText: But?
No, I don't.

Fields.DialogueText: What?
I don't eat meat either; I get most of my protein from nuts. I just don't talk about it much.
Captain, that's fantastic! But, you know--
Captain, I have a lead...
On what?
On the traitor who stole my gloves!
"Traitor" is a strong word.
I'm a strong Belle.
Now, science. I keep my gloves among my primary stack of books. Three crew have seen my collection, borrowed a book, and have been acting strange lately.
Who are the suspects?
Finch, Roger, and Mac. All of them are prime candidates for stealing my gloves!

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure your gloves were stolen?
All of this sounds crazy.
All right... where do we start?

Fields.DialogueText: I could tell you every book in the stacks around the ship, Captain. I don't lose things!
It may be crazy, but we have to find those gloves!
I'll do some investigating of my own first. I'll come to you when I get a lead!
Just try to stay out of trouble.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
No dispute there.
Don't worry, Captain! I'm the strongest in my class.
That's exactly what concerns me.
I'm not talking keech here! You want to get stronger, right?
Of course!
And you want to save on supplies for the ship, right?
Right!
So it's a win-win!

Fields.MenuText: What's a win-win?
Causing trouble?
Trying to get the crew to eat healthier?

Fields.DialogueText: Trying some veggies! While getting healthy!
If anything, I'm helping! I'm trying to get the crew to live a bit healthier.
And I've you to thank for it! What's good for the captain is good for the crew.
The Belle was telling me about how good spinach is for you.
I'm still skeptical about that.
It really is healthy! You and I are splitting a can at the next meal. First to finish gets to throw the other over their shoulder!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Ha! You're on!
I probably would have obliged if you'd framed it that way.
I wasn't in the mood at the time. One of these days...
So cold...
Edinburgh, you've been drinking tea nonstop. I can feel warmth radiating from you.
Distract me. Captain, do you have a favourite holiday?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a fan of Christmas.
Halloween is always fun.
Any excuse for a big meal, really.

Fields.DialogueText: It's always great to spread holiday cheer!
Dressing up is fun! Bit odd how the Americans combine it with begging for sweets.
Food is always good! Especially if we're talking about big dessert portions!
Personally, I like New Year's.
Really? I didn't expect that.
I love what it's about. You try to work on improving yourself, and setting your own goals to try and prosper. Do you have any resolutions for when the time comes?
Somehow I can never quite internalise them.
Well, that changes now! You've got me to hold you accountable.
From other Belles, that might concern me. But you're so darn positive today, I can't help but be reassured.
*ALARM*
If I just jinxed us both, I apologize profusely.
Nae danger, Captain. Blame the witches.
@BATTLE
That's because I've got no gloves to hold it in!
Captain, help me question this suspect.
Are you still looking for the one who stole your gloves?
Yes! You do remember the names of the suspects, right?
Finch, Roger, and Mac.
Things are looking up. There's Finch now. Oi, Finch!
Yes, ma'am?
The Captain would like a word.

Fields.MenuText: What do you know about Edinburgh's missing gloves?
Have you been busy lately? Seen any gloves lying around?
Gloves. Where are they?

Fields.DialogueText: I did notice that she hasn't been wearing them. Were they stolen?
What sort of gloves?
Whose are we looking for?
Let me take it from here, Captain. Now, I believe it was you who borrowed my copy of Ivanhoe?
That and nothing else!
Were they indeed!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Edinburgh...
Captain?
We'll have to table this. I'm watching you. Anything funny and I'm challenging you to a spinach eating contest.
Spinach? I don't understand.
You're better off that way. Trust me.
Strike one from the list of suspects.
Finch?
Yep! Plus, he returned my book that I let him borrow! Great one for romances, Finch.
Less so for getting thrown around.
Oh, that spinach will have him feeling like new in no time. We're one step closer to finding out who stole my gloves!

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure you didn't just lose them, Edinburgh?
You're lucky we have such a big crew.
So, what's next?

Fields.DialogueText: I've checked everywhere, Captain. I know for a fact that I didn't misplace them!
I didn't hurt him, Captain! I know my own strength.
Next, we question the other suspects!
What happens if we don't find the person responsible?
Well... my poor little hands will freeze!
And?
I won't be able to be at my best in battle, Captain!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Pretend our enemies stole them.
And I really, really, really like those gloves you got me. That's the crux of it.
Belter idea. Next time there's a spent barrel lying around, we'll have ourselves a proper caber toss!
Captain, am I interrupting?
No, not at all. I was just about to head to lunch with Edinburgh.
I made the Captain a delicious spinach pie!
I see. Mind if we discuss something in private, Captain?
I don't mind. I'll meet you in the mess, Edinburgh.
Okay!
Look. We've got to talk about an incoming food shortage.

Fields.MenuText: A food shortage? How?
We usually don't get low on food until resupply at sea happens. It's too soon to be low.
What do you propose we do?

Fields.DialogueText: Edinburgh has been really wanting the crew to change their diets. It's caused an imbalance in our consumption of food.
Unless you get Edinburgh to stop changing the crew's tastes, then we'll be down to just meat and potatoes.
We get Edinburgh to stop getting spinach into all the dishes.
I had a feeling this would be an issue. Next time I get the chance, I'll talk to her.
Thank you, Captain.
@BATTLE
Everything well sorted, Captain?
*ALARM*
Damn. I could actually go for some spinach right about now.
I've been keeping some on me! Come on, we'll split this can before battle.
Fine. But no shoulder throws.
Multiple enemies inbound, Captain!
How many Morganas?
A few. We need a course of action, Captain.
Keep the heid!

Fields.MenuText: Excuse me?
That's the idea!
I'm not sure what that means.

Fields.DialogueText: Keep the heid! It's a Scottish saying that means "Stay calm, don't get upset!"
What?
It means that if we don't get upset and stay calm, then we'll win!
Sometimes I wonder if you're just making these things up.
Belle, Captain! I'm distilled essence of Scot.
Anyway, do as Edinburgh said. Stay calm. We can do this.
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
Whoa! That was too close.
... Don't tell me. It's because I said-
Wasn't going to say it. I've been working on that.
Just stay calm!
Edinburgh, a moment?
Sure, Captain! What do you need?
It's about a food situation...
Nae danger! The crew have been eating healthy.

Fields.MenuText: Look, just take it easy with that, okay? We're low on food because of this.
I know, and you've got to stop the health initiative. The meals won't balance at this rate.
Try to make the food last until we resupply, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: I thought I'd missed something.
I'm sorry, Captain! I'll do my best to whip them back into their normal selves!
Maths, eh? I'll do my best.
And after I made that fash about the selection not being diverse enough. I'm sorry, Captain. I didn't know.
I didn't either until one of the officers told me.
I've been right skyrocket about this whole thing. Ever since I figured out spinach is a truth food...
A what now?
@BATTLE
Well, not spinach directly. You can tell a lot about someone once they're staring down a shoulder throw from a Belle.
Finch actually told me everything I needed to know right after I finished my half of the can.
*ALARM*
He was flat on his back for the rest of the day!
A promise is a promise.
The Italian Belle wrote to me again!
Really?
She is loving all of the books! To think I'd one day be discussing Stevenson with an Axis girl...
You've had a lot of letters lately. Lively debate?
And thriving membership! I'm surprised how many of us signed on, aboard me and otherwise.

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad that it's bringing some of the Belles closer. We need that at times like these.
What are you thinking of reading next?
I'm just glad to help.

Fields.DialogueText: Me, too! It turns out that some of us have a lot in common!
It's an autonomous sort of thing. We've learned to attack the list from all angles and respond to anyone who happens to overlap.
You're too modest, Captain! I know how zealous I can get with recommendations.
What did she write to you about?
She loves the stories about the heroes rising to leadership from nothing.
Some stories really are universal.
In the end. For the life of me, I'll never understand the ways some of those girls get there.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Well, it's a book club, not a debate team.
Oh, all art's political, Captain. But we've kept it civil. Mostly.
You know, Captain, I've been thinking.
About what?
Well... you know how much I love celebrating a victory.
I do. I hear you and the crew yelling from the cafeteria out of pure joy. They sing and you come barging into my quarters with a drink...
We should really do something special after one of these victories.

Fields.MenuText: We don't already?
What do you have in mind?
Is this about the bathhouse again?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, every victory is special. This one will be doubly special!
I want to teach the crew something unique!
No. Oh, by the by-
I'm going to throw a proper Scottish party.
Your parties aren't already Scottish?
Torpedo cocktails! Highland dancing lessons! Card games! Everything!
I'm not sure torpedo cocktails are specifically Scottish.
You'll certainly feel royal with a few cocktails in you! I'll send you a list of what we'll need.
No.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Every cultural touchstone starts somewhere. A good torpedo cocktail is a stone well worth touching!
Touching a stone... Isn't that how they crowned the kings of Scotland?
I'll say. You need to clear all of your galley activities with me after your spinach stunt.
What a right scunner is bureaucracy.
Scurvy's worse. Let's move to engage.
I had no idea you were part of the Church of Scotland!
Oh, aye!
You are full of surprises, you skinny malinky longlegs!
Take it easy! Or I'll gie ye a skelpit lug!

Fields.MenuText: Are you two having a... disagreement?
Uhh... what did I walk into?
Oan yer bikes, you reprobates! The whole ship's heavin' except the two of ye.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not, Captain!
Just some friends discussing their beliefs!
Awright, chief! We were just catching a quick howzitgoan.
Right, then. Outwith before the Captain goes heavy radge!
The international crews are a grand thing, Captain. But there's nothing quite like hearing a familiar brogue!
It's nice to run into a piece of home.
Aye. I also learned he's no glove thief.
I thought we were down to two names on that list of yours.
I never pass up the opportunity for knowledge. Who knows how long it takes for the truth-seeking properties of spinach to wear off?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Not the sort of thing that comes across in a letter, is it?
I caught you in a paranoid mood.
A bit. Light some witches on fire with me? That ought to clear things up.
Next suspect! Presenting Mac! Also known as - The Glove-Napper!
I don't have time for this.
Sit! Captain, begin the questioning!
Look, if he has work to do-
Question! The honor of my gloves is at stake!

Fields.MenuText: Sorry about this, but have you seen Edinburgh's gloves?
You can get back to work, once you tell me the location of her gloves.
Gloves. Now.

Fields.DialogueText: Look, I don't know what-
The only thing I have of Edinburgh's is a couple of Hume essays!
I don't have any gloves!
All I know is I heard something about gloves from one of the other crew members!
From whom?
Roger.
Another one of the suspects...
Can I go?
Hmm... Answer me this!
Objection!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Potential Glove-Napper.
What did Hume consider the main problem with philosophy as a discipline?
What?
Summarize it!
Gah! He advocated an empirical approach that centered human nature! Airy sciences! Don't throw me!
Ah, don't worry. You're clean. First go at the cocktails next time, aye?
Aye!
You've either too perceptive or not perceptive enough.
Spinach, remember? Besides, he did do the reading.
*ALARM*
Oh, thank God. I need the exercise.
Might warm your hands up again.
@BATTLE
Captain! Let's party! We really crushed the enemies this time!
I have a few minutes free... sure.
Bam! Torpedo cocktails! Congratulations, Captain!
On what?
On leading such a great campaign against the enemy! We've won so many battles!
We wouldn't have been so victorious if it wasn't for this ship in both her forms, Edinburgh.
That is true. Well, we both are to thank I guess! A toast! Lang may yer lum reek!

Fields.MenuText: Um... you too!
Water for me, thanks.
Slàinte mhath!

Fields.DialogueText: You bet! Wishing you a long, healthy life, Captain.
As long as you're drinking something!
Do dheagh shlàinte! Never thought I'd hear Gaelic on the high seas!
This is great. Excitement after a battle and the day's duties... your witch's brew to grease the wheels... I'm surprised the culprit hasn't outed himself.
I leave off the investigation at times like these, Captain. It's sacred to the crew.
Your gloves aren't sacred to you?
I'll learn to fight without my gloves. It'll take me longer to learn to like it.
Oh, aye. But there's one of me and seven-hundred-odd crew. I can deal with an annoyance, however annoying. I won't have everyone waiting for an interrogation during a party.
Just at every other time.
While they're on duty! They know what they signed up for.
Do they?
They learn quick, do our crew.
Finally. Finally!
Finally?
I have a feeling that this last suspect is the culprit.

Fields.MenuText: You really want those gloves, don't you?
You think so?
What happens if it's a dead end?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not just about the gloves, Captain! It's a matter of principle!
It has to be! We have no other leads!
Then I'm requisitioning even more spinach.
So what happened after you spoke with Mac?
I talked to him about what the gloves meant to me, and he was shocked at how could someone do such a thing!
And?
He swore to help me in any way he could!
Are you sure this is about the gloves, Edinburgh?
I'm sure a Belle has to fight like a pure dead madwoman for what's hers. Yes and no.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Look! The party has to be special!
More so than usual.
We need to really let loose!
We can't afford to go too crazy.
But we have to! The Captain will understand!
What's going on, you two?
Hello, Captain!
Speak of the devil! Captain! I need advice on how we should throw the party.

Fields.MenuText: What is it this time?
We still haven't fully discussed this yet, Edinburgh.
You're the Belle.

Fields.DialogueText: Above, with sport and feats of strength? Or below, with all the drink we can drink and no guardrails to fall over?
It's a work in progress!
And you're the captain! I have you to keep me grounded.
We can throw the party soon, okay?
Yay! Let me be in charge of organizing it!
That was never up for debate.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Oh, just you wait, Captain! There'll be drinking, and caber tossing, and flyting...
Flyting?
Ritual insults. All in good fun.
I have a lead, Captain!
This about the gloves again?
How did you know? Anyway, I know where Roger is.

Fields.MenuText: Just don't interrogate him, okay?
Finally, this "mystery" is coming to a close.
The sooner we get this done, the better.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll take it easy this time, Captain!
Isn't it exciting? If only Robert Louis Stevenson were here to take notes...
I agree. All there is now is to snag him when he's between duties.
Are you sure that he has them?
Positive.
Then promise we won't harass our shipmates anymore?
@BATTLE
If there's one thing I respect, Captain, it's proportion. The minute I catch the culprit is the minute I stop turning myself upside down in search of gloves.
Do me a favour and repeat what you just said.
*ALARM*
Can't hear you! Pack of M-words approaching!
I almost have the party ready, Captain!
The party? Oh, right!
I've got the haggis and mead all lined up, as well as some lessons on Highland dancing firmly in mind!

Fields.MenuText: You can't eat haggis. You're vegetarian.
Mead? I wondered what was fermenting in my closet.
Just as long as you don't ask me to help teach.

Fields.DialogueText: But the crew mostly aren't! Besides, consider it penance for my spinach initiative.
It's for a good cause, Captain! You'll have the space back after we're through.
You know enough to follow. I insist on a demonstration!
I think the crew will appreciate the gesture.
I hope they do. It's the least I can do after being such a terror this past little while.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
There's no way you could be more of a terror than the enemy.
Oh, but there is! Many ways, in fact. If what I hear from some of the book club girls is any indication, Command are well practised at looking the other way when it comes to us.
Is this about the Axis girls again?
Yes and no. I could tell you stories about my sisters that would have you begging for spinach...
Our last suspect in the missing gloves case. Roger, please enter the Captain's quarters!
Hello, Captain.
Now, I have a simple question to ask of you, Roger. Where are my gloves?
Y-your gloves? I-I don't know...

Fields.MenuText: Are you nervous about something?
If you know something, please tell us.
Look. I'm getting tired of this. Where are the gloves?

Fields.DialogueText: It's just, I can't say...
It was supposed to be a secret...
Spit it out!
I have them! I admit it!
So you're the reason Edinburgh's been stuffing us with spinach.
You can explain your actions in a trial! It'll be a small, quick process in the Captain's quarters! You better come back with a good reason!
O-okay.
@BATTLE
What?
Case closed?
So it would seem. I'll just phase into his quarters and take them back.
That still doesn't tell us why he took them in the first place.
*ALARM*
Well, case unclosed then. I'll be judge and jury.
No executions.
Of course not!
No shoulder throws, either.
... Oh, aye.
You seem awfully happy, Edinburgh. What's going on?
Well, you know the Italian Belle that has been sending me letters?
Yes.
She sent me a little carving of a four-leaf clover!
That is incredibly sweet...
I want you to have it, Captain!
Why?
Because you've stood by me through the whole gloves debacle.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you, Edinburgh
You keep it, Edinburgh. You deserve it.

Fields.DialogueText: You deserve it, Captain. Thank you!
Oh... Well, thank you, Captain... I'll cherish it!

Fields.MenuText: I believe I've been reining you in.

Fields.DialogueText: What did you think I meant, Captain?
Tell you the truth - I'm glad for a bit of mystery. I think if this had happened earlier in the tour... well, who knows how I might have reacted?
When you were more superstitious?
Oh, my beliefs are decidedly unchanged. Things I won't say, things I'd prefer to wear.
But if I'm to choose between making a whole crew respect my wishes and confiding in someone with the courage to question them... well, my conscience is clear.
Unquestioning obedience would get boring after a while.
Doubtless. Just ask Hume.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, we have to not hold a trial for my stolen gloves.
Why?
Look.
What's this?
The crew all pitched in and got me a new pair... They had taken my old pair for a size reference.
That's thoughtful.
Because they felt that they wanted to thank me for all the great memories I've shared with the crew... I feel awful.

Fields.MenuText: Have you talked to them yet?
Apologize to them. They know you meant well.
Are you going to be okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Not yet, but I plan on it.
I'm going to. I owe them that much at least.
I-I will. I just got to find them.
I'll make it up to them, Captain!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
... Could anyone throw you over their shoulder?
Leverage is more important than strength. There's not a sailor aboard who couldn't be taught!
We've got some teaching of our own to do.
So, how did it go?
How did what go?
Apologizing to the crew members about your gloves, Edinburgh.
They understood. They wanted it to be a surprise for the party.

Fields.MenuText: Did they accept your apology?
I'm glad it's over.
No matter what, everything will be fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. They apologized, too. It was a big misunderstanding.
Me, too. I shouldn't have overreacted.
Just as long as we're willing to call each other out when we're being numpties.
All that's left is for me to make it up to them.
By throwing you.
They'll be the special guests at the party! I'll teach them how to do a Highland dance!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Awright, and there will be throwing. Spinach is strictly voluntary.
Quite the shindig.
Amazing, right? The decorations, the games, the dancing... It's like the Royal Mile up on deck!
How'd you even do all of this?
Time and planning, between terrorising the crew. Our deck is large enough to spread it all around, so we did!
Where are the special guests? You talked about making it up to the crew members that you thought stole your gloves.
They're over there! Finch, Mac, and Roger. I just need to teach them how to stand and what to do.
Get up here, Edinburgh. We've got enemy contacts!
Damn! I'm in the middle of preparing the ship's party, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Don't blame me! Blame all of those ships on the horizon coming our way.

Fields.DialogueText: With pleasure, Captain!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'm not inviting them, Edinburgh.
I don't like it either. I'd rather be having fun, if I'm honest.

Fields.DialogueText: Never in a thousand years! Crash my party, will they?
We both know the answer, Captain. Time to roll up our sleeves and handle it!
And here I thought I'd have the opportunity to throw you around a little.
Oh, that can happen any time. What's a little fisticuffs between friends?
